intro: Stachys degenii, commonly known as the Armenian betony, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces spikes of purple to violet flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough, hairy texture. Stachys degenii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
